top_comments_top.body: I think you’re about four years behind lol. Even before they came out, Wolfmother was doing something similar but they didn’t quite hit that level of popularity.

I'm a big Led Zeppelin fan, been listening as long as I can remember,  when GVF came out my husband said I HAD to check them out, and now I hear them all the time on the radio... I just don't care. They're not bad,and I don't change the station. I just haven't been able to get into their music. It feels like it's missing something.

They get a lot of hate, which I don’t think is all deserved. Their music isn’t terrible for the most part, I’ve just never found it that interesting and as a Zeppelin fan I would rather listen to the real band . I don’t think it’s wrong to have musical influences, but GVF sometimes sound like what Zeppelin would probably sound like of they were to have kept making music as a band and not in a good way. Like in a formulaic and boring kind of way which happens to a lot of rock bands that have passed their prime a long time ago.
Have a listen to Tyler Bryant & the Shakedown - saw them live supporting Airbourne a couple years ago and loved them. A bit similar to Greta Van Fleet I think.
I like them and as you say, they are playing rock and roll.
